definition: Jin Dynasty (265-420)
surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to move forward/to promote/to advance
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: In the Jin Dynasty(265-420), there was a man called Zu Ti. He was a farsighted man with great ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 晉代有一個人叫祖逖，他是個有遠大抱負的人。

sentences.english: Chinese ancient landscape poetry came into being in the Jin Dynasty. It is the crystallization of poets natural aesthetic.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代山水詩形成於晉代，是詩人自然審美的結晶。

sentences.english: The author was Wang Xizhi, a calligrapher in Jin Dynasty in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 作者王羲之，中國古代晉代書法家。

sentences.english: Portrait of Wang Xizhi, the great Jin calligrapher, famed for his semi-cursive writing.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲最擅長寫行書的晉代大書法家王羲之。

sentences.english: Jin Dynasty is the developing period of the study of ancient books edition.
sentences.chinese: 晉代是古籍版本學的發展時期。

sentences.english: My whole ambition is to serve my country and maintain its greatness.
sentences.chinese: 晉代有一個人叫祖逖，他是個有遠大抱負的人。

sentences.english: Argumentation theory of the Jin Dynasty made tremendous progress, the number of critics increased, and research methods improved.
sentences.chinese: 晉代論說文文論較前一時期有了長足的進步。

offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
A New Account of the Tales of the World, collection of anecdotes, conversations, remarks etc of historic personalities, compiled and edited by Liu Yiqing 劉義慶|刘义庆[Liu2 Yi4 qing4]
the Hundred Schools of Thought, the various schools of thought and their exponents during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (770-220 BC)

almanac
Tao Zongyi (c. 1329-1410), Yuan dynasty scholar

the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])
Qi of Southern dynasties (479-502)
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
to spread/to hand down/to disseminate
divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)
